content: man attends (achtet) either to his needs (braucht) or what he can do w/out; latter not calculation, considers everything from a standpoint limited to essential: only apparent restriction, really a release into expanse of demands that befit man’s essence, attending to dispensable (Entbehrliche) brings man into simplicity, totally other (ganz anderen) domain [no calculation = limited to essential?]

content: subjugation to technology doesn’t appear as resistance/resentment [hide behind love? Nietzsche]
linkedContent: subjugation to technology doesn’t appear as resistance/resentment [hide behind love? Nietzsche]

content: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth
linkedContent: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth

content: for inception of our history [contra will of modern technology], for Greeks, decline was unique, momentary, laudable, great > decline of unique vs. perishing, clinging fast to the ordinary > what is imperishable [indestructible] in inception: rarity/singularity of each varied return of what is originary w/in it > experience of inception: realize what essentially came to be known at inception itself > the thought-worthy [value]

linkedContent: we hear Greek thinkers, must think about fact that everything has to do w/ us [imperative of hermeneutics of facticity]

content: what is thoughtworthy isn’t “thinking” but what challenges thinking, what places thinking in its service, bestows rank/value on it [thinking beyond “logic” as pathos of distance?]: extend thinking toward manner in which ground includes us in its essence, come into proximity w/ what strikes us essential, become aware, listen our way to where we belong [Gelassenheit]

content: realm of beings not identical to domain of actual (also: stringency of necessary, wealth of the possible) > strikes ordinary understanding as a truism: a being either possible, actual or necessary > what passes itself off as even more self-evident: “beings” are [“is” method]

content: we say “being,” really mean beings > distinction (Unterscheidung) pervades (durchwaltet) every speaking (Sagen), every comportment (Verhalten), about/toward beings > “weather is fine,” the “is”: inconspicuous manner in which this being “thus and so” exists

content: “is” must belong to visible leaf itself
linkedContent: “is” must belong to visible leaf itself

content: [Bill Clinton] no instruments to measure/comprehend the “is” of what we mean by “is” > what would happen to our everydayness if we genuinely thought over “is,” lingered over it [Freud, fetishism of lingering]
linkedContent: [Bill Clinton] no instruments to measure/comprehend the “is” of what we mean by “is” > what would happen to our everydayness if we genuinely thought over “is,” lingered over it [Freud, fetishism of lingering]

content: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)

content: we move w/in differentiation of being & beings [good summary of ontological difference] > [“is” method] that we must continually say “is”: being wants to be put into a word, one we always mis-hear
linkedContent: we move w/in differentiation of being & beings [good summary of ontological difference] > [“is” method] that we must continually say “is”: being wants to be put into a word, one we always mis-hear

content: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]

content: in thinking, we move in ontological difference > [***] perhaps too much, inappropriate to speak of the differentiation btwn Being/beings in 1st place, difference already objectified w/out being able to specify where it belongs [why is belonging what makes it inappropriate?] > talk of the differentiation: differentiation is origin of all differences [differance, but it would erase origin]

content: Goethe’s “is”: inexhaustibility of wealth to which we aren’t immediately equal
linkedContent: Goethe’s “is”: inexhaustibility of wealth to which we aren’t immediately equal

content: “is” must be empty acc. its essence [khōra] > [Being as fetish]“is” distinguishes itself through poverty of meaning, even more so for noun “being”: emptiness/indeterminacy made into a fetish: being as most real being
linkedContent: “is” must be empty acc. its essence [khōra] > [Being as fetish]“is” distinguishes itself through poverty of meaning, even more so for noun “being”: emptiness/indeterminacy made into a fetish: being as most real being

content: for Plato, being most authentic being; for Nietzsche, being as most negative [no!] > Plato/Nietzsche part of same interpretation (doctrine of Western metaphysics): being is the most universal of the universal (koinotaton)

content: to consider beings as a whole, can/must cling to beings [dogma? whose?]
linkedContent: to consider beings as a whole, can/must cling to beings [dogma? whose?]

content: [re: clinging to beings, equating dealing w/ the actual] acting (Handeln)/effecting (Wirken) bring to experience what the actual (Wirkliche) is [?], accompanied by freedom, participation in law of age > acc. Heidegger, Nietzsche’s freedom [“for what is freedom? that one has the will to self-responsibility”] conceives being a self as will to power, freedom as will to fulfill “will to power” (Nietzsche thinks like/unlike Kant): participation in actuality of actual

content: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings
linkedContent: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings

content: Being as its own opposite: a discord (Zwiespalt) w/in Being itself > but this discordant character, as essential to Being, is held together in unity of an essence: das Sein gerade nicht zerspalten sein im Sinne einer Zerstörung seines Wesens [Being cannot be split in sense of destruction of its essence]

content: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

content: [Being creates rank but isn’t ranked?] [highest thought resuscitates Being (w/out rank)?] > Being: most common (Gemeinste) & unique (Einzige)

content: to be equivalent (Gleiche) something other/additional (mehreres) is needed [Marx & commodity] > to be the same (Selbe), only uniqueness is needed > as the same & unique, Being is forever different from/in itself (but different not in the sense of twice over, repeatedly (mehrmal), or able to be split into multiplicity), incomparable distinction

content: Being thoroughly common in all beings, thus most common [radical leveling of metaphysical privilege] > each being finds its equal (Being), can be compared (vergleichen), but Being never finds its equal, over & against all beings, unique, can’t be compared

content: is Nothing (Nichts) a 3rd thing, distinguished from Being & beings? > es gibt the Nothing > der Schrecken vor dem Nichts: terror before the nothing—do we understand it? could we if Nothing was indifferently negative?
linkedContent: is Nothing (Nichts) a 3rd thing, distinguished from Being & beings? > es gibt the Nothing > der Schrecken vor dem Nichts: terror before the nothing—do we understand it? could we if Nothing was indifferently negative?

content: [possible thoughts re: Nothing, cf. Einführung, no threat or threat where there are beings?]
linkedContent: [possible thoughts re: Nothing, cf. Einführung, no threat or threat where there are beings?]

content: Nothing “is” turns Nothing into a being? > Nothing doesn’t need beings but it needs Being > perhaps Nothing is the same as Being, it is unique & incomparable: its essence as incontrovertibly incomparable belongs to Being, confirms Being’s uniqueness
linkedContent: Nothing “is” turns Nothing into a being? > Nothing doesn’t need beings but it needs Being > perhaps Nothing is the same as Being, it is unique & incomparable: its essence as incontrovertibly incomparable belongs to Being, confirms Being’s uniqueness

content: success [in science] never proof of truth, always “consequence” of a grounding principle that must be questioned, never decided by continually dependent result
linkedContent: success [in science] never proof of truth, always “consequence” of a grounding principle that must be questioned, never decided by continually dependent result

content: [in atomic age, in atomic physics] what is “unforeseeable (Unvorhersehbare),” can’t be calculated/computed in advance, shows itself as something new, can’t be explained by something else—lacks a cause (atomic physics, w/ its invalidation of law of causality, refutes Kant, all previous philosophy [?]) > what is “uncaused,” [acc. atomic physics]: “spontaneous,” free

content: Being (distinct from beings) is the most intelligible [?] [because nobody requires a specific notion to take it for granted?] > should we determine Being from Nothing? but Nothing is the indeterminate per se

content: Being as most worn-out coin (abgegriffenste Münze), what is most self-understood, that which we constantly pay for every relation to beings: Being, most worn-out, most indifferent > even when we want Nothing, Being remains, resists expenditure/consumption > in extremity of desired annihilation of all beings, Being must appear [cf. Open Manifest, total annihilation? Being makes annihilation of beings possible]

content: Being withholds itself from any grasping on basis of beings, denies itself every concept, every determination, illumination, in every respect for every attempt at an explanation [what about every name???]: thus Being withholds itself, withdraws: self-concealment belongs to being: Being itself “is” concealment ——Being is the most worn-out (Abgegriffenste) > [beings as testimony to Being] lay claim to Being whenever we experience beings > Being expended (in a way) in constant/multiple use in all relation to beings, but Being not used up in expenditure, remains constantly available to us [cf. Open Manifest]

content: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]
linkedContent: Being lets every being as such originate: Being is the origin ——no doubt about Being, the most reliable [but don’t we know Being by way of experience of beings?]

content: Being as the groundless, can’t ground our plans on it, no foundation to place whatever we erect, continually gives way, offers no support, the refusal of every expectation (that it could serve as a ground)
linkedContent: Being as the groundless, can’t ground our plans on it, no foundation to place whatever we erect, continually gives way, offers no support, the refusal of every expectation (that it could serve as a ground)

content: we 1st depend on beings because released into beings, this dependence put into word, pervasive in “is,” “are”: in each “tense-word” of language we name being [“is” method] > Being said w/ every word, verbal articulation—if not named each time w/ its own name [?] > Being as pre-giving of what 1st permits naming of beings (not addition (Zugabe)/supplement (Beigabe) [cf. Derrida])

content: constraint of Being forces beings into Being, Being plays around & through us
linkedContent: constraint of Being forces beings into Being, Being plays around & through us

linkedContent: [summary of Being] “is” holds us in its essence, even in its non-essence (forgetting of Being)

content: Heidegger asks whether the determinations of Being are arbitrary, whether he is using the device of opposition: he postpones a decision re: these questions [does he return?]
linkedContent: Heidegger asks whether the determinations of Being are arbitrary, whether he is using the device of opposition: he postpones a decision re: these questions [does he return?]

content: Being like the fleeting cloud of a shadow, like that which doesn’t effect (bewirken) anything or leave behind a trace (Spur) [khōra]

content: beings always have their equal [Being] > Being is incomparable, unique, always the Same, a sameness that doesn’t exclude differences [indifference point] > no various Being, can’t break up into multiple/numerous [dissemination vs. plurivocity]
linkedContent: beings always have their equal [Being] > Being is incomparable, unique, always the Same, a sameness that doesn’t exclude differences [indifference point] > no various Being, can’t break up into multiple/numerous [dissemination vs. plurivocity]

content: [indifference point not dialectical sublation] Hegel could never say “Actuality” and nothing are the same, though he does realize both are most extreme abstractions of “actuality” > attend to the following only in passing [?]: Nothing presences, not the nullity people apply to it > when Nothing rests on fancy, mere play of understanding, the emptiest & the unique [just like Being] > Nothing not a nullity (for us): horror towards devastation, recoiling in terror of annihilation: shrinking back from something that can’t be addressed as mere imagination or something baseless

content: what if Nothing is same as Being? Being something horrifying/dreadful, something that assails us [annihilation of trace?] > [is this why we become indifferent to Being, why we flee to reassurance via the “self-understood”? Mitsein]
linkedContent: what if Nothing is same as Being? Being something horrifying/dreadful, something that assails us [annihilation of trace?] > [is this why we become indifferent to Being, why we flee to reassurance via the “self-understood”? Mitsein]

content: philosophical critique of contemporary physics [science], reflection can’t limit itself to examination of “law of causality” > predictability a principle of knowledge of beings, so even physics converts ontological law into “epistemological principle” (an error, a fall), “quantum metaphysics” > science helps indicate “being” as most intelligible (hardly noticed attitude at bottom of claim of physics)

content: instructions (Anweisungen) for reflection [askesis], procure modestly a preparation (Vorbereitung) for resolve to follow meleta to pan, to know what’s incipient in Western thought, what’s said in the inception > struck by word from inceptive saying: clearer readiness (Bereitschaft) for direction (Richtung) toward which we must listen

content: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

linkedContent: Being “is”: doesn’t Being become a being in this phrase, become what it’s supposed to be differentiated from? can it ever become manifest as Being?

content: in modernity, never before achieved “objectivity” supposed to be reached because man has become a subject > in modernity, Being anthropomorphized, we don’t come into relation w/ Being itself, only what humans represent it as [can we ever come into relation to it???], “humanize” Being

content: “natural” way of thinking, no genuine insight can reach Being, only beings “are”

content: only “beings” remain: what does that mean? > stand btwn 2 equally unavoidable limits: 1) we cast being away from us (das Sein wird von uns verworfen [cf. Freud foreclosure]) when we say Being “is” 2) can never disavow “Being” & “is” wherever we experience a being [“is” method]

linkedContent: in the casting away & toward us don’t wish to capture what opens up in a formal schema of formal thinking [does name Being remain formal???] > impasse stems from Being itself? guidewords indicate a peculiar ambivalence of Being

content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

content: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence
linkedContent: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence

content: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]
linkedContent: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]

content: man as natural entity = “rational entity” [?] > inviolability of Being [indestructible], its abode, up until now, we could only call “impasse”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: man as natural entity = “rational entity” [?] > inviolability of Being [indestructible], its abode, up until now, we could only call “impasse”

content: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]
linkedContent: [alibis] “have done (fertig)” w/ Being by appealing to this/that being (avoid abode [of Being]) > abode (Aufenhaltes) [of Being] contains an exacting expectation (Zumutung), demand to experience abode of historical man, originates from claim of Being itself, claim comes from still-concealed essence of history > a strange demand, don’t minimize [lose hold] of this strangeness (Befremdlichkeit), we need history itself to make us remember, give us hints for reflection, a reflection that grants us remembrance of 1st inception of Western thought [strangeness as trace] > why is that? only inception itself can tell us [heterotautology?]

content: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences
linkedContent: inception has been, but not something past [inheritance], still presences, but concealed in its incipience [trace], perhaps inception of Being closer to us than everything we know, imperishable (Unvergängliche) [indestructible] > remembrance of inception not concerned w/ beings [how so???], but w/ what has been, i.e. what still presences

content: [Heidegger against MOP] sight/sense for closest of all proximities suppressed by power of actual, latter presumed to become measure for each respective being & Being
linkedContent: [Heidegger against MOP] sight/sense for closest of all proximities suppressed by power of actual, latter presumed to become measure for each respective being & Being

content: [practice, method, askesis] justifications for attempt meaningless if attempt at such remembrance not carried out: remembering return into 1st inception of Western thinking brings w/ it all signs of violence [risk the worst?]
linkedContent: [practice, method, askesis] justifications for attempt meaningless if attempt at such remembrance not carried out: remembering return into 1st inception of Western thinking brings w/ it all signs of violence [risk the worst?]

content: ground is inclusion that gathers out of itself & into itself, a gathering that grants the Open where all beings are [but not causa sui?]

content: Being withdraws from us when we say it > “Being has singularly burst open our human essence” > “we belong to Being, and yet not” >  homeless in our ownmost homeland, not directly allowed in—assuming we may thus name our own essence

content: long acquaintance w/ man, no guarantee man is in right position to ask who he is—not to mention find answer that would possess sustaining power to bring essence of man to fulfillment in historical humanity
linkedContent: long acquaintance w/ man, no guarantee man is in right position to ask who he is—not to mention find answer that would possess sustaining power to bring essence of man to fulfillment in historical humanity

content: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”

content: one can capture “lived experiences” in reports > essence of man securely delimited: man is the presencing animal (animal rationale) [?] > balance btwn “calculability” of life & drunkenness of lived experience > anthropology, Americans seek determination of what man is, how he can be most efficiently/effectively used (am wirksamsten zu gebrauchen sei) , in most appropriate place, w/out loss of time or energy [Marx-like]

content: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]
linkedContent: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]

content: remembrance into first inception is fore-thinking into more incipient inception > remembrance is placement into Being itself > Being remains closer to us than everything nearest, farther than all that is farthest > only appear to escape Being in favor & for sake of beings, whose density fills every openness > must become aware of our abode: becoming aware not just raising Being into consciousness [not mindfulness]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: remembrance into first inception is fore-thinking into more incipient inception > remembrance is placement into Being itself > Being remains closer to us than everything nearest, farther than all that is farthest > only appear to escape Being in favor & for sake of beings, whose density fills every openness > must become aware of our abode: becoming aware not just raising Being into consciousness [not mindfulness]

content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
